intro: Scabiosa pseudobanatica, commonly known as the Persian scabious, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, aiding in water retention. The flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
